channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: The McKinney Student Writing Contest Is Now Open!
item.description: The 2025 McKinney Writing Contest is open, and both undergraduate and graduate students are invited to submit entries in a wide range of categories to win cash prizes! Entries are due by midnight on March 11, 2025. Please see the McKinney Writing Contest page for more information, or email the contest committee if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: CEE Seminar Series to Continue December 4
item.description: Date: Wednesday, December 4, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - In a talk titled “Building Resilient Cities: The Role of Advanced Computational Models in Wind Engineering,” Dr. Seymour MJ Spence, Assoc. Professor from the University of Michigan, will explore the role of artificial intelligence, particularly deep learning of latent spaces, in significantly accelerating the evaluation of complex nonlinear systems influenced by stochastic models representing extreme natural hazards.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Four Steps to Effective Communication: Extended DISC” Topic of Fall Graduate Lunch & Learn Workshop
item.description: Date: Wednesday, December 4, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:30 PM - The Extended DISC system is based on behavioral theories that have been used for over one hundred years. In this workshop, presented by Will Fahey, Manager of Professional and Organizational Development, participants will complete an Extended DISC questionnaire and receive individualized reports that reflect both their “natural” and “adjusted” behavioral styles, and learn strategies that promote successful interactions with others.
item.author: Community

item.title: Kite to Hold Wógligleya/Imákȟaheye (Geometry/Method) Workshop for Dream Scores
item.description: Date: Thursday, December 5, 2024 3:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Performance artist, visual artist, and composer Kite engages with Rensselaer student musicians in a workshop for dream scores, and invites audience members to observe a free afternoon open rehearsal as she leads the student ensemble in her artistic practice, discussing the musical potentials of experimental notations/scores when interpreted and embodied through sound.
item.author: Community

item.title: Nick Donofrio ’67 to Speak as Part of Alumni Engagement Speaker Series
item.description: Date: Monday, December 9, 2024 5:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Please join the RPI Office of Alumni Engagement for this fascinating program as alum Nick Donofrio ’67 discusses his book “If Nothing Changes, Nothing Changes” and his life experiences with an audience of alumni, students, and faculty; he will also share lessons learned from almost six decades in business and innovation. A limited number of signed copies of Nick’s book will be available, followed by a holiday mixer.
item.author: Community

item.title: Bid on a One-of-a-Kind Model of the Original Chicago Ferris Wheel!
item.description: You can own a one-of-a-kind model of the original Chicago Ferris Wheel! The model can be viewed in the Folsom Library, and bidding ends on Monday, December 2 at 11:11am ET, with all proceeds to benefit the United Way. Please visit the United Way Silent Auction page for bidding rules, and to scan the QR code to place your bid. Bid high, bid often!

item.title: Blackboard Maintenance Scheduled for December 26
item.description: Campus community members should note that Blackboard will be performing required maintenance beginning at 1:00am on Thursday, December 26, 2024. The maintenance is scheduled to last approximately six to eight hours, and the LMS will not be available during this time.

item.title: Design Lab Showcase to be Held Wednesday, December 4
item.description: Scheduled to take place from 2:00PM to 5:00PM on Wednesday, December 4 in the DCC Great Hall, the Design Showcase will feature students from multiple engineering disciplines — including Computer & Systems, Electrical, Industrial & Management, Materials and Mechanical Engineering — solving real-world design challenges for industry, entrepreneurs and academic/medical partners.

item.title: Collegiate Store Holding Black Friday Sale Through December 2
item.description: From now through Monday, December 2, shop ONLINE ONLY to enjoy the Rensselaer Collegiate Store’s annual Black Friday Sale, featuring up to 30% off clothing and gifts!

item.title: Don’t Miss the Bicentennial Time Capsule Burial Ceremony on December 3!
item.description: Date: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 1:00 PM - In celebration of Rensselaer’s Bicentennial, all members of the campus community are welcome to attend this Time Capsule Burial Ceremony outside of the ’86 Field side of the Troy Building! The time capsule, which will include letters capturing the spirit of RPI in 2024, will commemorate the Institute’s legacy while giving future generations a snapshot of our vibrant community. Cupcakes to follow!
item.author: Community

item.title: Harteck Lecture in Physical Chemistry Slated for December 3
item.description: Date: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - The Department of Chemistry’s seminar series continues with the Harteck Lecture in Physical Chemistry featuring Victor S. Batista, Professor of Chemistry at Yale University, who will speak about “Simulating Chemistry on Bosonic Quantum Devices.”

item.description: Date: Wednesday, December 4, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register for this virtual event to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D. as he reviews this innovative project-based, online MBA for professionals program. Participants will learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with real-world MBA experience, prepare to lead the most dynamic and innovative organizations, and engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential.
